result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Fae Mountford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Fae Mountford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Fae Mountford was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan Fae Mountford in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendations agreed upon. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in jail, with Huber. $443.00 costs. 23 days jail credit. 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample.  11:07/11:12.
